SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: NORTH10, PHILADELPHIA IS COMMITTED TO IMPROVING LIFE OUTCOMES FOR THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS OF HUNTING PARK AND EAST TIOGA NEIGHBORHOODS THROUGH ITS FOUR PILLARS OF EDUCATION, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT, HOUSING, AND WELLNESS. 3890 NORTH 10TH STREET, L.L.C. WAS INCORPORATED ON JULY 29, 2005, FOR THE PURPOSE OF TRANSFORMING AN ABANDONED SEPTA REPAIR STATION AT 3890 NORTH 10TH STREET INTO A MODEL COMMUNITY GATHERING SPACE, CONSTRUCTING THE LENFEST CENTER (THE "CENTER"). LOCATED IN THE HUNTING PARK SECTION OF NORTH PHILADELPHIA THE 52,000 SQUARE-FOOT LENFEST CENTER WAS DESIGNED AS A SAFE AND WELCOMING COMMUNITY- FOCUSED HUB OFFERING YEAR-ROUND RECREATIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND OTHER RESOURCES FOR NEIGHBORHOOD CHILDREN AND ADULTS TO LEAD HEALTHY AND FULFILLING LIVES. ON DECEMBER 21, 2014, 3890 NORTH 10TH STREET, L.L.C. WAS CONVERTED FROM A PENNSYLVANIA LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANY TO A DELAWARE NON- PROFIT CORPORATION AND ITS NAME WAS CHANGED TO 3890 NORTH 10TH STREET, INC. IT WAS THEN DOMESTICATED AS A P
